title: Did Elvis invent rock and roll? - Quora

response.answer_text: Oh, no, it is widely believed that the first rock and roll record was “Drinkin’ Wine Spo-De-Oh-Dee” by Stick McGhee on Atlantic Records, released in 1949. It has been recorded subsequently by several artists, but Stick wrote it and sang it for years. Pass that bottle to me. In that same glorious year at the prelude to the 50s, a group called the Dominos recorded Sixty Minute Man” about”old Dan”, who could “rock ‘em,roll ‘em, all night long, he’s the sixty minute man”. ( You did know what rock and roll meant, didn’t you? No, Elvis didn’t invent anything. He built on the black sound of Stickand Little Richard andChuck Berry, and blended a little Hillbilly from Earl Monroe and others, to merge with Carl Perkins rockabilly style. He never wrote a song, and he stole the knock kneed hip grinding from the dirty shag crowd that made “beach music” in South Carolina. But boy, , could he sell it. He added a sneer, and an attitude, and a sexuality that nobody could match. Elvis invented Elvis, which took Rock and Roll to the masses.

No. No one person did and certainly not Elvis. As the Rock and Roll HOF would put it there were many “Early Influencers” from the Blues, Big Band/Swing, Gospel and Country/Rockabilly. If I were going to make a list of the direct “godfathers” of what came to be known as “rock and roll” in the 50s, there would be six names: Ike Turner (“Rocket 88” considered the first “real” rock n roll record) Chuck Berry (Put everything — music, lyrics, style — together in a package with the guitar as the lead instrument) Bo Diddley (The “Bo Diddley Beat”) Carl Perkins (Father of Rockabilly) Fats Domino (crossed over from New Orleans style jazz/dixie to pop/rock) Little Richard. (like Chuck Berry, put everything together with a bit more emphasis on gospel’s call-and-response style)

No. The elements for Rock N’ Roll have been around for well before Elvis walked into Sun Records. Artists like Sister Rosetta Tharpe, Bob Wills, Bill Haley, Joe Hill Louis, and Harmonica Frank Floyd were rocking well before Elvis. As a matter of fact, Harmonica Frank Floyd was the inspiration for Sam Phillips to find another white guy who could perform black music. What Elvis brought to the table was that element of commercialism. Sister Rosetta Tharpe was a gospel performer. Can’t serve both God and Mammon. Bob Wills, Bill Haley and Harmonica Frank Floyd were all older folks. Kids aren’t gonna buy a record that looks like their dad made it. And Joe Hill Louis the world just plain wasn’t ready for. Elvis had the looks, he had the voice and he fit the role that Sam Phillips needed at that exact moment. And what the Rock N’ Roll movement needed at that exact moment.

No, but he invented the rock star. Which is just as important. Rock and Roll had been around in various forms for a while before Elvis came along. Jump Blues, R&B and country were all showing signs of heralding the dawn of rock and roll. Elvis was one of a number of artists who combined aspects of them all into Rock and Roll. Bill Haley did it before him but Bill Haley looked like this…  Haley was a massive success in the UK up until the point where toured. Most artists increase their appeal when they do concerts but Haley killed his fanbase when he showed up. When the fans saw Haley and his band and realised that they were older, overweight and not very sexy, they turned off their music. He had a string of top ten hits in the UK before he toured but none afterwards. Elvis added sex appeal to rock and roll and created the rock star.

Elvis was a pioneer in rockabilly music that consisted of country , and rhythm and blues, His number one hit was HEARTBREAK HOTEL in 1956. He became the leader in the rock and roll sound. His first film was LOVE ME TENDER in 1956. Presley is the best selling solo artist and won three Grammys, a GRAMMY Lifetime Achievement Award at age 36 and inducted in many halls of fame. He died in 1977 at the age of only 42 due to cardiac arrest and years of drug abuse.

He was certainly one of the inventors, breaking into a version of That’s All Right in Sun Studio In 1954 that blended Country and Blues, then making it a regional hit. The same could also be said of Bill Haley, Chuck Berry and Little Richard. All of whom did similar things, independently around the same time. You could include Bo Diddley and Fats Domino too.

Elvis Presley absolutely did not invent rock and roll; it was floating around during the 1950s as a fusion of elements from the blues, country, folk and gospel, with some nods to popular R&B hits and simpler jazz tunes. Most people credit the first real rock and roll record to Bill Hailey and the Commets’ “Rock Around the Clock”.

Nobody invented rock and roll. It evolved from swing and jump blues, and marketers found that they could sell more of it if they came up with a name for it. Genres are names given to musical forms by people who wanted to sell recordings and sheet music based on the “If you liked that, you’ll like this” technique.

No. It existed before Elvis. There are several contenders (listed below). Personally, I'd say that Chuck Berry' is most widely associated with Rock n' Roll and of any artist, did the most to commercialize and popularize it.
Rock ’n’ roll has been around a long time long before Elvis who started recording in 1954. In fact, he would be the first to admit that he didn’t invent rock’n’roll.
Music with the word Rock was played by black singers in the late 40s/early/50s. The words rock n roll were coined by d j Alan Freed. So the answer is no. But he had the biggest influence on it.
While Elvis was the King of Rock, he did not invent rock n’roll. He certainly made it a famous genre. He made rock n’roll famous, but Bill Haley is the one who invented rock n’roll.
No but he damn sure got it going!!!!! Remem he is in 3 separate Hall Of Fames- Country, Gospel , Rock&Roll So he was working other music genres b4 Rock& Roll-
Not exactly. Little Richard and other black artists are equally inventors of this new music fusion of rhythm and blues.
No, he did help it along though. Like dozens of others. He didn’t invent, as much as synthesize stuff he heard, as well as put an attractive (white) face on it.
Short answer: No. No one individual did. Long answer: Who Really Invented Rock 'n' Roll
He didn’t actually invent. R and R. He was the one who started the revolution. Without him R and R wouldn’t have been what it was.
No. But Elvis, Chuck Berry, Fats Domino and Little Richard together pretty much did.
No. Early R&R was basically covers of early 50’s R&B tunes.
No, but he was Rock and Roll’s first Superstar.
No. Not at all. Not even close.
No but he was the king
No
No
No
No.
